critique: The document primarily focuses on the procedural aspects of civil service employment within the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC). It details the transition of certain positions into the classified civil service and outlines the conditions under which existing employees can acquire civil service status. Given its focus on internal administrative processes and civil service regulations, the document does not directly address broader ideological or political themes. Therefore, most axes are close to neutral, with a slight lean towards federalism due to the expansion of federal control over FDIC positions.
